events.entities: Aerodrome Finance DNS Hijack & Frontend Compromise
events.eventSummary: Aerodrome Finance is investigating a DNS hijack and frontend compromise targeting Base Ecosystem users.
Oracle was reportedly wrong about a vulnerability, which was found after LAPSUS$ posted their exploit on Telegram. Similar issues are noted with SAP and Siemens industrial control systems.
CrowdStrike has identified an insider feeding information to hackers.

events.entities: PayPal, Netflix, TikTok Phishing Scam Campaign
events.eventSummary: Hackers are targeting PayPal, Netflix, and TikTok with a new phishing scam.
The DragonForce hacking group claims to have breached C&M Software in Brazil, allegedly exfiltrating 393.9 GB of data. The ransom deadline is November 29, 2025.

dailyBrief: This was a high-threat day in cyber risk, with multiple high-severity incidents reported. Aerodrome Finance suffered a DNS hijack and frontend compromise, while C&M Software faced a major breach and ransom demand from DragonForce. CrowdStrike uncovered a dangerous insider threat, raising concerns about internal security. There was also a notable phishing campaign targeting major consumer platforms, and Oracle's vulnerability misjudgment highlighted ongoing risks in industrial systems. The trend shows a mix of targeted attacks on fintech, critical infrastructure, and user platforms, with insider threats and ransomware standing out as top alerts.
